required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Daclatasvir/Sofosbuvir/Ribavirin for 16 Versus 24 Weeks for HCV Genotype 3 Cirrhotics
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Adding Daclatasvir to the Combination of Sofosbuvir (SOF) and Ribavirin (RBV) for 16 Weeks Versus 24 Weeks in Cirrhotic Subjects With Chronic Hepatitis C Infection Genotype 3

lead_sponsor.agency: Tarek I. Hassanein, M.D., FACP, FAG, AGAF

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a randomized, open label, single center safety and efficacy study. At least 40 cirrhotic subjects with HCV genotype 3 will receive standard of care treatment of sofosbuvir and ribavirin (SOF/RBV) as well as 60 mg daily of Daclatasvir (investigational product). Subjects will be randomized in a 1:1 to receive either:
- Group A: 16 weeks of DCV/SOF/RBV
- Group B: 24 weeks of DCV/SOF/RBV
Subjects will return to the study center at various time points throughout the 16 or 24 weeks of treatment in addition to 12 weeks post taking last dose of study drug to monitor safety and efficacy. These visits will be according to standard of care.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (start of study drugs) to last day of taking study drugs; an average of 20 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: This field states the number of participants who had an adverse event

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Safety Laboratory Tests (ALT and/or Total Bilirubin) That Required Discontinuing Study Drugs
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (start of study drugs) to last day of taking study drugs; an average of 20 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: This field states the number of participants who had an abnormal ALT that required discontinuing study drugs and/or abnormal Total Bilirubin that required discontinuing study drugs.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Undetectable HCV Virus 12 Weeks After Stopping Study Drugs
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (start of study drugs) until 12 weeks after stopping study drugs
primary_outcome.description: Sustained Virologic Response (SVR) defined as undetectable HCV RNA 12 weeks after stopping study drugs.

arm_group.description: Combination of sofosbuvir 400 mg daily, ribavirin 1000-1200 mg daily (weight based) and daclatasvir 60 mg daily for 16 weeks
Combination of sofosbuvir 400 mg daily, ribavirin 1000-1200 mg daily (weight based) and daclatasvir 60 mg daily for 24 weeks

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Tarek I. Hassanein, M.D., FACP, FAG, AGAF

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Group A - 16 Weeks
group.description: Combination of sofosbuvir 400 mg daily, ribavirin 1000-1200 mg daily (weight based) and daclatasvir 60 mg daily for 16 weeks daclatasvir, Daklinza Sofosbuvir, Sovaldi Ribavirin

group.title: Group B - 24 Weeks
group.description: Combination of sofosbuvir 400 mg daily, ribavirin 1000-1200 mg daily (weight based) and daclatasvir 60 mg daily for 24 weeks daclatasvir, Daklinza Sofosbuvir, Sovaldi Ribavirin

baseline.population: A total of 39 participants started treatment with sofosbuvir, ribavirin and daclatasvir. 21 were randomized to Group A (16 weeks of treatment). 18 were randomized to Group B (24 weeks of treatment).

group.title: Group A - 16 Weeks
group.description: Combination of sofosbuvir 400 mg daily, ribavirin 1000-1200 mg daily (weight based) and daclatasvir 60 mg daily for 16 weeks daclatasvir, Daklinza Sofosbuvir, Sovaldi Ribavirin

group.title: Group B - 24 Weeks
group.description: Combination of sofosbuvir 400 mg daily, ribavirin 1000-1200 mg daily (weight based) and daclatasvir 60 mg daily for 24 weeks daclatasvir, Daklinza Sofosbuvir, Sovaldi Ribavirin

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.description: This field states the number of participants who had an abnormal ALT that required discontinuing study drugs and/or abnormal Total Bilirubin that required discontinuing study drugs.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Undetectable HCV Virus 12 Weeks After Stopping Study Drugs
outcome.description: Sustained Virologic Response (SVR) defined as undetectable HCV RNA 12 weeks after stopping study drugs.
outcome.time_frame: From baseline (start of study drugs) until 12 weeks after stopping study drugs
outcome.population: The analysis covers only the subjects who reached the 12 weeks after stopping study drugs time point. 19 of 21 participants randomized to Group A reached that timepoint and 16 of 18 participants randomized to Group B reached that timepoint.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Study received IND approval in November 2014. Daclatasvir received initial FDA approval in July 2015. Participants were randomized to receive daclatasvir for either 16 or 24 weeks and were followed per standard of care.
